message.content: <local-command-caveat>Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.</local-command-caveat>

content.text: For a remediation I've selected both Cursor as agent and target rendering. After clicking on "Execute Remediation", the modals shows me "copilot". Investigate why and fix this bug

content.thinking: The user selected "Cursor" as target rendering and "Cursor Agent" as the AI agent, but the confirmation modal shows "GitHub Copilot" for target and "cursor" for provider. Let me find the relevant frontend code.

content.text:
Found the bug. Look at lines 816-821 in the confirmation modal  the target agent display logic only handles three cases (`agents-md`, `claude-code`, and falls through to `"GitHub Copilot"` for everything else), missing the `cursor` case entirely:

```tsx
{targetAgent === "agents-md"
    ? "AGENTS.md"
    : targetAgent === "claude-code"
        ? "Claude Code"
        : "GitHub Copilot"}
```

When `targetAgent` is `"cursor"`, it falls through to the default `"GitHub Copilot"`.

Also, the provider display on line 825 just shows the raw `selectedProvider` value (`"cursor"`) instead of using the provider's `displayName`.

input.old_string:
Target for markdown file rendering {targetAgent === "agents-md" ? "AGENTS.md" : targetAgent === "claude-code" ? "Claude Code" : "GitHub Copilot"}
Provider {selectedProvider}
input.new_string:
Target for markdown file rendering {targetAgent === "agents-md" ? "AGENTS.md" : targetAgent === "claude-code" ? "Claude Code" : targetAgent === "github-copilot" ? "GitHub Copilot" : "Cursor"}
Provider {availableProviders.find((p) => p.name === selectedProvider) ?.displayName ?? selectedProvider}

content.content: The file /Users/cedricteyton/Code/agents-md-evaluator/frontend/src/components/RemediateTab.tsx has been updated successfully.

Provider {availableProviders.find((p) => p.name === selectedProvider) ?.displayName ?? selectedProvider}

content.text: Now let me also make the target agent display more robust by using the same label map from the buttons above, rather than a fragile ternary chain. Actually, the current fix handles all 4 cases properly. But let me verify the `TargetAgent` type to make sure there aren't other values I'm missing.

content.text:
All clean. Here's what was wrong and what I fixed:

**Bug 1  Target agent label**: The ternary chain in the confirmation modal (line 816-821) only handled `"agents-md"` and `"claude-code"`, defaulting everything else to `"GitHub Copilot"`. When `"cursor"` was selected, it fell through to `"GitHub Copilot"`. Fixed by adding the `"github-copilot"` case explicitly and making `"Cursor"` the final fallback.

**Bug 2  Provider display**: The modal showed the raw provider name string (`"cursor"`) instead of the human-readable display name (`"Cursor Agent"`). Fixed by looking up the `displayName` from `availableProviders`.
